AboutSection.desc:
If I were to describe myself in three words, they would be: full-stack developer, multilingual user, and creator-driven builder.

I hold a degree in Software Engineering and have built my development experience primarily through self-directed learning and hands-on projects. To me, code is not merely a tool for implementing features, but a form of expression that balances logic, structure, and creativityâ€”demanding precision while still allowing room for aesthetics.

My first complete project began with a simple motivation: building a sustainable fan website for a work I deeply admired. I initially focused on front-end development, and as the project evolved, I gradually introduced back-end modules to support user interaction and data management. Through this process, I learned how to break abstract ideas down into executable features, refine system structure through iteration, and improve usability over time.

In addition to programming, I work and create in Chinese, English, and Japanese. I previously participated in a paid internship program in the United States, and later passed the JLPT N1 through self-study before moving to Japan. I see strong parallels between programming and language learning: both involve understanding rules, building structure, and making complex ideas accessible to others.

Every master was once a beginner who refused to quit.
